name: 白敦文
objective: This course is designed to provide important topics in bioinformatics and computational biology. Students are able to learn about problems involved in the generation and analysis of biological data such as DNA, protein sequences, and protein structures. The course is intended to provide good understanding of the commonly used algorithms in the analysis of genomic data, and hands-on experiences with accessing and using relevant databases.
schedule:
1 Introduction to computational biology/bioinformatics 
2 Access to Sequence Data and Related Information
3 Pairwise and Multiple Sequence Alignment
4 Basic Local Alignment Search Tool (BLAST) 
5 Advanced Database Searching 
6 Molecular Phylogeny and Evolution
7  DNA: The Eukaryotic Chromosome
8 Midterm
9 Analysis of Next-Generation Sequence Data
10 Gene Expression: Microarray and RNA-seq Data Analysis
11 Protein Analysis and Proteomics 
12 Protein Structure Analysis
13 Functional Genomics
14  Human Genome and Human Disease
15 Project reports
16 Final
materials: Bioinformatics and Functional Genomics 3rd Edition by Jonathan Pevsner
